comment: Spicy, strong flavor but very smooth
Great nose. Standard MGP. Honey. Very sweet. Medium finish.
Solid.  Hard to get 12 year juice anymore.  Love the oak profile and the sweet nose.
I have this bottle. Good color, good aroma, good flavor.
Sweet but young. Citrusy start with honey finish
Pours bright amber. Cinnamon, maple, and oak aroma. Oak with red hots and hot alcohol in the finish. Light, slightly oily body.

Nose - caramel, apples, and varnished oak

Palate follows the nose with caramel, vanilla, apples, and baking spices

Finish is pleasant but short, with some creamy vanilla and spice
This grew on me from the 1st glass to the 2nd glass. Very smooth.  $61

Sweet, distinct fresh cut wood shavings
Slightly too woody
Not lengthy in aftertaste

Neat.  Nice nose.  Vanilla and floral.  Maybe cherry.  Fresh oak.  Nice creamy mouth feel.    Nice sugar and dark fruit on the tongue.  Lovely taste and long legs.  Strong vanilla.  No spice.  Complexity I can’t put into words.  Just a great sipper by a fire.
Excellent bourbon smooth and higher proof.  Hard to get but worth it.  Touch higher in price than I would like (hence the smaller rating than a true 5)
Plenty of flavor through and through. Very impressed with this bourbon. Under rated
Simply Amazing! Great Oak flavor with a sweetness, some vanilla and caramel to finish off with a nice creamy feel. Just wonderful
Sweet with strong burn  Harsh taste.  Short finish.  Can't get past the harsh taste.

The nose on this one is bright fruity with hint of tea.
The palate a drastic change from the nose it is subtle vanilla with just a hint of spice the finish is clean and short. I can understand why some may take issue with this since the nose and palate aren't even close but both are great just exceptionally different.

5/11/19
N: Caramel, vanilla, fruity sweetness, brown sugar 
P: Caramel, vanilla, fruit, a little cinnamon
F: medium, fades to oak
I'm so mad this is no longer available. this is a travesty
Very oaky. Preferred th 10 yo, which was great.
Fabulous. MGP juice. One of my favorite pours. Interesting, very smooth. Carmel Apple all the way.
Tasted again, not sure I like it.
Vanilla, honey and oak. This is very good. Getting no burn.
Smells floral, taste of honey, vanilla, very smooth, no burn.
Apricot and honey. Smooth finish.  I would say this is the perfect bourbon for a post dinner drink. A real good pour
